headline: Chickpea Salad with Red Onion and Tomato
description: Chilling makes all the difference in this great salad. And the generous splash of olive oil and lemon juice brings out all the great veggie flavors. The chick peas add variety and a nice texture.
name: Chickpea Salad with Red Onion and Tomato

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, red onion, garlic, tomato, parsley, olive oil, lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Chill for 2 hours before serving. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve.

review.reviewBody: So simple yet delicious! The quality of tomatoes makes a difference and since it's winter in Michigan, my choices weren't great. I think I'll try quartered cherry tomatoes until summer gets here. Thanks for a simple, healthy recipe!
I LOVE this recipe! Have been making it and adding variations according to what I have on hand (quinoa, beans, sweet pepper...) - tastes even better the day after!

Bland. I thought this was a different chickpea salad that I've made before and didn't have time at Thanksgiving to really research it.
The only thing this salad has going for it is its healthiness.
This was almost tasteless and I won't make it again.
My guests barely touched it - chickpeas aren't for everyone I guess. I'll know better next time.
I like to add cilantro (instead of parsley) and cherry tomatoes. Some dill instead of parsley or cilantro would be good too.
This was so good I could have eaten the whole thing by myself. I know it said to chill for 2 hours but I couldn't wait.

This isn't bad exactly -it's hard to argue with fresh tomato in anything. But it feels like a salad for people who don't like really heavy dressings or uh...a lot of flavor. Not terrible but I probably won't be making again.
I added cook spinach to the salad, warmed it up a bit and added some turmeric, cumin and garman marsala. Loved it.
The only change I made was used cilantro instead of parsley. It was really tasty!
Delicious and simple. Give it an hour or two for the flavors to develop.

I felt like the flavor of the garlic and the onions overpowered the tase of the chickpeas. Next time I make it, I will probably do two whole tomatoes and maybe double the amount of chickpeas. Not too bad, but it wasn't my favorite.
I like to toast the chickpeas over a bit of oil then add cumin to coat.
I added half an orange pepper and some broccoli chopped small to hide it from the kids and sneak some vegetables in.

easy delicious recipe! I used yellow sunburst cherry tomatoes, and yellow onion. Fresh basil, parsley, thyme, and oregano all from my garden. I also used olive oil and red wine vinegar instead of lemon juice.

I give this 5 stars for being both healthy and delicious. I also used regular chickpeas and soaked it overnight instead of buying the canned ones. You can adjust the lemon depending on how tangy you want it to taste. I would make this over and over again.
Delicious
added to much garlic but other then that it was really good.
I added cucumbers, yum
OK, but bland, as is. Took it up a notch with balsamic vinegar. If you really want to take it up two notches, put on balsamic vinegar and Sriracha chili sauce.
This was a big hit at our family gathering. I will definitely make it again.
Excellent. I like a bit more flavour so added some cumin and balsamic vinegar. So much better than any of the store bought. Thank you for the receipe!!
Excellent.
Delicious. Definitely will make again.
yum!
So good! Simple ingredients combine for a wonderful flavour. I used sliced grape tomatoes instead of a whole tomato, and dried parsley since I didn't have any fresh. Delicious!
I added cumin and tumeriic for both health and flavor. Also, cut back a bit on the red onion, so as not to overwhelm the other ingredients.

This was amazing! We like a little more tang in our dressing, so I juiced two lemons for this, and added a splash of balsamic. It really does taste even more incredible once you let it sit in the fridge for a couple hours. We literally drunk the "dressing" in the bottom of the bowl after we ate all the salad.

Super yummy! The only thing I would have done differently is to add more lemon juice, I would have liked more acidity to the dish. Very vegetarian friendly dish! Hardy salad with great combination of flavors. Loved it! Will make it again.
Simple to put together and has a great shelf life in the fridge.
Great low-carb, high- protein summer bean salad!
As a different twist, I added black beans, vegan mayo balsamic vinegar, and dill
Very refreshing salad, but the taste was a little bland. May need a better dressing.

I made this for a potluck where it was well received. Used 3 cans of chickpeas (didn't measure most ingredients as someone else suggested) and added some balsamic vinegar, an additional small clove of garlic and a bit of cilantro along with the parsley. My husband gives it a five star rating, I say 4.5 but let's not quibble ;) We are looking forward to the little bit of leftovers today.

I think this is a good base recipe, but found the flavour pretty bland and too garlicky (and I LOVE garlic). I ended up adding Greek dressing to it for flavour as I didn't have time to find another recipe. In the future I will use the main ingredients but find another dressing and not be adding garlic.
This was good though much, much better the second day.

This recipe was very good....i added red wine vinegar to the recipe...thank you....i make this all the time and we all like it very much....sometimes i use roma tomatoes as they dont get mushy. Also we add black olives chopped at times. Family likes black olives alot. enjoy....i always rinse off the chickpeas before i make the salad....canned type

My husband and I really like this. I made it with parsley, exactly as written the first time. Made it again with cilantro, because I didn't have fresh parsley. We liked it both ways, but I added 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar and some fresh spinach to the cilantro version because the dressing didn't seem strong enough. I think the cilantro may have a stronger flavor than the parsley, and it needed more flavor in the dressing.
I followed the directions but added some cucumber and another garlic clove, very refreshing.
Love all the ingredients. Suggest basil as well.
Will make it again tomorrow,it is easy and differen from the green salad which we eat so often.
Very light and refreshing side! I added a bit of fresh mint and balsamic. Let sit overnight, and it's even better.

Great side salad. Nutricous & low fat. Good source of fiber.
 Definitely making it again.
I added cilantro instead of parsley, because that's what I had available. It was yummy. My book club loved it.
Delicious chickpea salad. I added a cut up plum tomato & cucumber. Marinating overnight made it even better!

I will not make again. 
It was very boring it needs more zing!!

I liked this, however the hubby didn't care for it at all. Neither did the children. I was the only one who would eat it. Apparently none of them care for the beans. I suggest to others to do a survey of who in your family likes garbanzo beans before you fix this. Apparently the beans aren't as mainstream as I thought. If I make it again I will use a whole carton of grape or cherry tomatoes. I also like the balsamic suggestions. I will try that as well if I make again. This is NOT date night food. Major garlic breath with this one.
Very good! I added chicken for my (ahem) NON-vegetarian husband, a few extra chick peas and he really liked it. Next time I make this, I'll use a bit less oil--mine was a little too oily.
Delicious and refreshing. I did what others suggested and added a splash of balsamic. It was just right with that.
Simple and amazing!
Used black beans instead. Added fresh cilantro and some "Cranberry Wlanut" dressing Everybody loves it. I make all summer long!
This is excellent. I used cherry tomatoes and added extra parsley and garlic. Everyone loved it. This is a keeper. Thanks for sharing.

I loved it and as one replier said, i want to try with cilantro.

I would love to marinate chicken breasts with the ingrediants minus chick peas to see how it tastes.
I'm very fond of this one! I occasionally switch things up a bit, using some black-eyed peas or field peas with the chickpeas, but the end result is very similar.

This is an awesome salad. We served it as a side with grilled salmon. Quick...easy...tasty. How do you beat that? We used fresh tomatoes from the garden and fresh parsley. The only thing I would do differently is use cherry tomatoes the next time...maybe try it with balsamic vinegar as well. But, it is great jus the way it is! Thank you so much for sharing!!!!
Great recipe. I didn't have any fresh parsley so I had to use dried. I also added a chopped yellow pepper and 1 cup cooked quinoa. Will make again!
Yummy! Great summer salad! Thank you for the recipe.
Mild flavors
Oooooops! I forgot the parsley, but the salad turned out great. Next time I'll take it out of the fridge half an hour before serving because it was very cold.
Stuck with the recipe ingredients but added a little more onion, added basil and feta cheese. AMAZINGLY DELISH!!
So simple and delicious!!! I added some penne and made a pasta salad and it was even better!! Definitely a keeper.
Awesome!
I absolutely loved this salad!! Doubled the garlic and lemon!! Was a huge hit!! I will be making this again!
This was good and very easy to put together. I thought the raw garlic tasted a bit strong, but overall I was pretty pleased.
great recipe, will definitely make again. thanks for sharing.
Have made this salad countless times. Delicious! Love it in the summertime alongside of grilled chicken. Simple and awesome!

My whole family loves this recipe! I usually sprinkle in dried Italian seasonings instead of fresh, easier and faster for prep time for me. Everyone that tries this recipe loves it, even the picky eater in my house.
i added more onion, and used Flax Oil to make it more healthier. Top it with Tuna and you have yourself a hearty healthy meal

Great multi-purpose recipe. Made a double batch and gave half to my dad for a healthy Superbowl snack and brought half to my sister while in the hospital after having her daughter. Super easy prep and clean-up and it keeps well in the fridge for a couple days. I upped the lemon and added a splash of balsamic vinegar, delicious!
loved it! Super easy to make. Makes a great meatless main dish
It was a good summer salad, but I think I added too much garlic. It was a bit over-powering.
My husband and I are both big fans of this salad. It is a great blend of flavors, healthy, and easy to make.
Easy and delicious!
Yum! I didn't have parsley so I substituted cilantro and it tasted great. Will try it with parsley also. Wonderfully tasty and healthy recipe.
This is a great summertime salad. Healthy and delicious. Will make this often. I reduced the olive oil to 2tbs.

This is one of our new family favorites! I great way to get my boyfriend to eat his veggies, too. I've made it along with the recipe and I've also made this with whatever veggies I needed to use up, adding cucumbers, green peppers, etc. It's my new go-to dish when I need to bring something to a picnic. It's different from anything else and keeps well all day.
yum from Laura and josie
This is a great salad for picnics and camping! Lasts in a cooler. Since my family doesn't like tomatoes I just omit them and it's still yummy! One of our standard salads year round. Thanks Jen!
A five star recipe as is (I rinsed the beans), and i think it's even better if you add capers and a little caper brine. Super simple and even bean-haters liked it!
Loved this. Made it about a week ago and am looking forward to making it again real soon!
good, but I was the only one in my family that liked it. Course, I love chickpeas. And, even I thought it was so so. Maybe I'll try again in the summer when tomatoes are better.

Such a great easy salad recipe. Those who say its too much sodium.,you must first rinse the chickpeas before tossing with the other ingredients.This will reduce the sodium content of this dish. I also added chopped fresh oregano to the mix. Great for BBQ's or potlucks.
My boyfriend and I love this little side dish! It has so much flavor and so simple, perfect for summer time cook outs!
Added some balsalmic vinegar for some more flavor. It was fine, but not great.
I increased the amount of chickpeas, tomato, onion and lemon, and cut the oil in half. I also doubled the garlic due to the increased beans. Quite nice.
Quick, easy, and delicious! I bring this in to work with me for lunch a few times a week and I love it!

Very delicious with garden fresh tomatoes. Don't dice the onion too big. I like to add a little chopped fresh mint along with the fresh parsley or half parsley, half cilantro. DON"T use dried herbs in this recipie! Try adding crumbled feta cheese and sliced pitted Kalamata olives, if you like them. If not, regular black olives may be substituted. Prepare a couple of hours in advance for the flavors to marry. I also strongly prefer this served at room temperature. Yum!

This recipe is delicious! I made it for Christmas dinner as the healthy option and everyone loved it. I followed a couple suggestions from other reviews. 1) I used grape tomatoes rather than a regular tomato. 2) I used a little more garlic because you can never go wrong with more garlic. 3) I made sure to add fresh leaf spinach...so good! I also decided to add cilantro to the salad. Turned out great!! My husband is asking me to make this again next week!
I added black sliced olives to this recipe...that extra color and flavor made it even better! Also, used about 4 medium sized (home grown) tomatoes instead of just one...yummy!!
very good salad! Added chopped green and kalamata olives and a splash of red wine vinegar, cucumber would be good added to it as well.
Nice in its simplicity. Reduced oil to 2.5 TBSP.
very good, but found it needed a touch of red wine vinegar for some bite.
Great Salad!! I added a little feta cheese on top and it was even better.

Really good salad! I made a few changes: I used a basket of Cherry tomatoes, cut in half; I also added a couple splashes of Balsamic Vinegar; and since my family LOVES Cilantro (I know many don't), added about 1 T. of freshly chopped Cilantro. It was sooo good. Very refreshing out on the deck. Garbanzos (and other legumes) are so healthy and very good to help control blood sugar, as well as adding fiber to the diet. So a healthy choice!
An easy to make, healthy, light summer salad. Great for a picnic. Added diced cucumber and red bell pepper and it came out prettier than the picture.

This is so fresh tasting and deliciuos! I used the dried chickpeas because I did not want mushy beans. I brought them to a boil and let them sit for an hour vs. soaking over night, rinsed them, and simmered them for two hours. I used a pint of grape tomatoes each cut in half and a half cup of kalamato olives cut into fourths. I plan to make this several times a year and will cook the beans ahead of time and freeze them to save time.
Added a touch of Balsamic Vinegar and served it topped with some fresh grated parmesan cheese. Excellent!

Fairly bland, but I like that it's very healthy and nutritious. I added a cucumber for some additional volume and flavor. I will also be adding some vinegar to give it a bit more flavor, but overall it was tastey. LOVE garbanzo beans.

This recipe is a great base to add to, but by itself it seemed a bit lacking. I added some balsamic vinegar and pepper to taste and some chopped kalamari olives for a little more flavor as well as some cubed cucumber to fill it out a bit. Fresh and filling!
Added more color to the salad by throwing in chopped celery and feta cheese, absolutely wonderful!

This was pretty good, especially considering how quick it is to throw together, and I liked that it only made a small amount to try it. Chickpeas/garbanzo beans only come in 16oz cans, so I just used that and it was also low-sodium and worked fine. The only thing I left out was the pepper, because I don't care for it, and we ate it right after it was made. I tasted what was left the next day and I actually preferred it fresh anyhow. With all the garlic and parsley the smell and taste gets too strong, in my opinion, when it sits. So, it did work good for a salad in a pinch.

item.name: Chickpea Salad with Red Onion and Tomato
